title: Data reporting with RMarkdown: from novice to master
description:
This meetup will cover basic features of RMarkdown and a few tricks that may help to create professional analytical reports using data. RMarkdown is a markup language, which enables users to embed R code in the document, edit text and document styles, and render visual information. Documents created using RMarkdown can be exported in a variety of formats, including .docx and .pdf.

Knowledge of RMarkdown allows R users integrate text and data analysis results in one place easier, including data checks, tables, and visualization. Additional benefit of RMarkdown is its ability to present data and analysis in interactive manner but this feature is out of the focus of this meeting.

===
Password for Zoom meeting: 486933
===

title: R Fika, or Informal talk about everything R related
description:
Let's meet in the midst of summer to discuss everything interesting, new, and helpful about R in informal manner!

The event is organised online (the link is available for those who will attend). But don't forget to bring your cup of coffee/tea for cozy atmosphere! :)

If there's any issue or question, don't hesitate to contact us here.

P.S. In Sweden, Fika is something like a coffee break with hot drinks and sweets but the focus is on socialising.

title: R Basic: Graphs (Part 2)
description:
These online events will cover the very basics of R and making graphs, which will be ideal for newcomers into the language.

This is a “code walk-through”; this means we have a code we follow and learn from directly. All the code and data used for this exercise will be provided after the session ends. This also means there is no need for you to run the code or write it down in your Rstudio script as we go along.

As you will learn fast, a lot of the code you will use in R is already written somewhere in the internet. The task for the user is to understand what is happening and learn how to consult the reference guides or how to “google” for answers.

In this session, we will focus on learning a couple of ggplot2 important concepts and making things pretty without so much effort.

Part II - Other types of graphs
Making things pretty: ggthemes, Rcolorbewer and patchwork

Requirements for part II:
Being able to create a scatterplot in R on your own using basic and ggplot2

Contact us here if you have any questions or comments before or after the event!

Find the event here: https://meet.jit.si/IntroToR

title: R Basic: Graphs (Part I)
description:
These online events will cover the very basics of R and making graphs, which will be ideal for newcomers into the language.

This is a “code walk-through”; this means we have a code we follow and learn from directly. All the code and data used for this exercise will be provided after the session ends. This also means there is no need for you to run the code or write it down in your Rstudio script as we go along.

As you will learn fast, a lot of the code you will use in R is already written somewhere in the internet. The task for the user is to understand what is happening and learn how to consult the reference guides or how to “google” for answers.

For this first session, users do not need any background information or knowledge. Users with little to some experience may find this first event slow.

Part I - Basics: install and call packages, load dataframes (datasets) and assignments
Making scatterplots: Base and ggplot2

Requirement for Part I:
No special requirements

Part II - Other types of graphs
Making things pretty: ggthemes, Rcolorbewer and patchwork

Requirements for part II:
Being able to create a scatterplot in R on your own

Contact us here if you have any questions or comments before or after the event!

Link to the event: https://meet.jit.si/IntroToR
You can open this link in a browser in your computer. If you use it in your phone you will be required to download an app.

title: First R-Ladies Meetup: Introduction to the community and R Basics
description:
Welcome to the first event of R-Ladies Gothenburg!

At this first event, which is hosted in collaboration with the Department of Political Science at the University of Gothenburg, we will introduce the R-Ladies community and review of the main concepts for working with R.

Please bring your computer with R and RStudio installed. If you need help with this step, contact us beforehand or watch this online tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=orjLGFmx6l4.

Please confirm your attendance here on Meetup and make sure to arrive on time. The doors to the main building automatically lock at 6:30 pm, which means that you will not be able to enter the building unless you have a valid university keycard.

If you have not already responded to our Pre-Meetup Survey, please do so using the following link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdE11TxP52Vq1Pew_c3dmj-jfPivwNP3NjFnDpB1dToY_xioQ/viewform

Most welcome!

R-Ladies Gothenburg Team

venues.name: Department of Political Science, University of Gothenburg
